'''May It Be''' is a song composed and sung by [[Enya]] for [[Peter Jackson|Peter Jackson's]] ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' with English and [[Quenya]] lyrics written by longtime Enya collaborator [[wikipedia:Roma Ryan|Roma Ryan]].<ref name="AnnotatedScore">[[Doug Adams]] ([[2006]]), ''The Annotated Score (Part I: The Fellowship of the Ring)'', p. 23</ref> It was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Song in [[2002]].

It is the final track of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' and the eighth track of the third disc of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring - The Complete Recordings]]''.

==Lyrics==
<poem>
May it be an evening star
Shines down upon you
May it be when darkness falls
Your heart will be true
You walk a lonely road
Oh! How far you are from home

Mornië utúlië ([[Quenya]] for "Darkness has come" mornië=darkness, utúlië=has come) 
Believe and you will find your way
Mornië alantië (Quenya for "Darkness has fallen" mornië=darkness, alantië=has fallen)
A promise lives within you now

May it be the shadow's call
Will fly away
May it be you journey on
To light the day
When the night is overcome
You may rise to find the sun

Mornië utúlië (Quenya for "Darkness has come")
Believe and you will find your way
Mornië alantië (Quenya for "Darkness has fallen")
A promise lives within you now
A promise lives within you now 
</poem>
